content.question: A particle moves along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>-axis so that at any time <math alttext="t is greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> its position is given by <math alttext="x of t, equals, one half times, open parenthesis, a, minus t, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a positive constant. For what values of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the particle moving to the right?

choices.label: The particle is moving to the right only if <math alttext="0 is less than t, which is less than a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></math>.
The particle is moving to the right only if <math alttext="a, is less than t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></math>.
The particle is moving to the right only if <math alttext="t equals a." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></math>.
The particle is not moving to the right.

content.answer: The particle is moving to the right only if <math alttext="a, is less than t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></math>.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
